mendelian_inheritance_examples.description: Sample scenarios demonstrating various Mendelian inheritance patterns using the Zygotrix Mendelian traits collection

scenarios.title: Classic Dominant Inheritance - Dimples
scenarios.description: Demonstrates how a single dominant allele produces the trait

crosses.interpretation: Classic 3:1 phenotypic ratio for dominant trait

scenarios.title: Verified Single-Gene Trait - Red Hair
scenarios.description: Real-world example of a verified recessive trait controlled by the MC1R gene

crosses.interpretation: All offspring are carriers but don't express red hair
Two carrier parents have 25% chance of red-haired child

scenarios.title: Sensory Trait - PTC Tasting
scenarios.description: Ability to taste phenylthiocarbamide (PTC) - a well-studied taste genetics example

crosses.interpretation: All offspring can taste PTC despite one non-taster parent

scenarios.title: Physical Trait - Hitchhiker's Thumb
scenarios.description: Thumb hyperextension ability showing recessive inheritance pattern

crosses.interpretation: All offspring have straight thumbs but carry the recessive allele
Classic recessive inheritance - only homozygous recessive shows trait

scenarios.title: Behavioral Trait - Hand Clasping
scenarios.description: Complex behavioral trait with variable expression patterns

crosses.interpretation: Heterozygotes show variable hand clasping preference
Demonstrates complex inheritance patterns in behavioral traits
All offspring have normal pigmentation but are carriers
Two carrier parents have 25% risk of child with albinism

educational_notes.dominant_inheritance: In autosomal dominant traits, only one copy of the dominant allele is needed to express the trait. Examples: dimples, freckles, cleft chin.
educational_notes.recessive_inheritance: In autosomal recessive traits, two copies of the recessive allele are needed to express the trait. Examples: red hair, albinism, hitchhiker's thumb.
educational_notes.verified_vs_simplified: Verified traits have strong scientific evidence for single-gene control (like MC1R for red hair), while simplified traits are textbook models that may involve multiple genes in reality.
educational_notes.gene_information: Some traits include specific gene information (MC1R, TAS2R38) showing the molecular basis of inheritance.

filter_verified_traits.description: Get only scientifically verified single-gene traits
